description:
This is definitely one of my favorite Starbucks in San Francisco.  Great location, large windows for people watching, spacious, plenty of all different kinds of seatings with good Wifi and outlets.  Restrooms clean and accessible, those behind the counter are pleasant and efficient.

If you're looking for a place to do some work or take a break, highly recommend.  

I like this place!
author: Steve M.

description:
My go to Starbucks before work. Purely for the convenience of being able to order while in Bart then picking it up on my walk to the office.

Like most locations the staff is friendly, quick, and the taste is going to be just what you expect to get.  I just wish that there was a better system for their mobile pickups.  Sometimes I come in and my coffee is sitting behind the counter ready to go, but I can't get the attention of anyone to hand it over because they are so busy.
author: Joanne T.

description:
I did a couple mobile orders there. I won't be back. A guy Batista for the morning shift, will keep
Me from going back.  First time I was reprimanded for pointing to the drink that was out of my reach. The next day he accused me of using a false name. My husband and I share account. But really- did I just walk in off the street and pull a random name out of my ass?  Never going back, I need my mornings to start with less drama.   Please put him in an evening shift!!! Or get rid of him!!  Check out the review theme, this place will ruin your morning start.
author: Sandy N.

description: Food and drink here are the same as all Starbucks. At this location, customer service appears nice at first but the staff doesn't k own how to multitask, given more than one specific job their work ethic falls apart and they can't get anything done. All they seem to focus on is coffee and ignore all other orders, online food orders and customers waiting for pickup of their online orders.  Go to another location unless you want to wait for anything except coffee.
author: Cory B.

description: Their app said they served nitro cold brew, but they didn't. Thanks for wasting my time waiting in line.
author: Eugene A.

description: Being a little further away from Market street helps with the crowds. I feel like in the morning there are still a good number of people who come here and there is constantly a line, however it is not as long of a wait as locations that are near by.  On the weekdays in the morning there are always 3-4 employees and they are all friendly, fast, and good at making the drinks.
author: Justin Y.

description: It's my first time going here and my last. I had to repeat my order multiple times so they can still get it wrong. The guy who wears a beanie raised his voice towards me and kept trying to correct my order. Also they tried to give me a grande when I paid for a venti.
author: Viviana G.

description: Worst customer experience I've ever had at a Starbucks. Manager was too busy talking to people in the lobby to help. Two of us stood in line for 3 minutes before it was even acknowledged that we were standing in line. Order was as simple as they come and it was still messed up. Orders an iced coffee with room for milk no sweetener. Came to me sweet and filled to the brim.
author: Bradley V.

description: It's what you'd expect from a Starbucks; employees are friendly and remember your name, mobile ordering system works, and everything else is normal. They close a little early since it's a business area, but that's fine, I don't need caffeine late at night!
author: J.P. M.

description: Fat dude with a ponytail creeps me out every time I go there! He tried to screw with me and waste my time when I already showed him the recipe I wanted. All the other employees there understood me immediately and were professional, except for that creepy fat dude with a ponytail. Made me feel uncomfortable with his unprofessional manners and gestures. I hope he no longer works there so I can get my cup of coffee in peace.
author: Customer L.

description:
This Starbucks is just around the corner from the Palace Hotel where we were staying. I came here to get two sausage breakfast sandwiches for under $7 versus the $70 plus room service breakfast from the hotel as part of our rotation. 

The kids enjoyed both and the staff are very pleasant and nice.
author: Christina W.

description: They seem to always screw up my order. They are so nice, it's hard to even write this review without feeling bad. That being said, for being downtown, it's one of the cleanest Starbucks in the city. And they have a good variety of the Starbucks food that the one near the wharf does not.
author: Jessica D.

description:
This is the probably the second-worst Starbucks I've been to. Definitely avoid during the morning rush. On my last visit I placed a mobile order in advance and still had to wait 20 minutes, so what's the point. They messed up my order not one (I caught it) but two (they caught it) times. Impressive given that the mobile order sticker says exactly what to make. 

I'd be more understanding if the staff wasn't full of attitude. No thanks, I don't need that kind of negativity in my life. But it's cool, because while a Starbucks gift card used to be as good as cash to me, a visit is now a rare occurrence, as my coffee palate has matured and I've discovered that San Francisco has *way* better (and cooler) coffee options.
author: Cristina S.

description:
This location is usually crowded during the workday, even more so around lunch time. They are efficient though, moving lines along quickly. It is roomier than the average Starbucks with a communal table as well as high tables and chairs facing the alley that is Jessie St.

Half of the people occupying the tables are students and tourists, the rest out-of-towners. Even though it can get busy I'd go here over other nearby Starbucks.

Note careful when using Online Order. It may not go through even though the app says the order did.
author: Peter L.

description: Smells like mold and old water as soon as I walked in . Sill bought a coffee though hahaha . But really it smells.
author: Cory T.

description:
It's really strange to wait for 15 mins to get your coffee at Starbucks considering there are 3 other outlets in a 3 block radius from this place. They generally have 2 people taking orders and only one barista making the coffee during rush hour and so it comes as no surprise that there are long lines every morning. 

Waiting time aside, the mocha is really good and they get the customization right every single time. I've never walked out of this outlet thinking my coffee isn't exactly the way I asked for it. 

PS- Please do something about the waiting time! There are times when I look at the line through the glass door and just walk away because I can't spare 15-20 mins in the morning!
author: Gaurav K.

description: I've only been here once, but the cashier/barista, Paul, is so friendly AND my eggnog latte was made to perfection!
author: Maricel S.

description: I've been going for a couple months now 4 days a week before work because of the convenient online order pick up but almost everyday they ignore you even when you call them out about your order. And what's worst? The people's attitude. This is probably the last day I'll be going here because their attitude will ruin your day.
author: Juke J.

description: Fast and efficient, this Starbucks is.   I was in and out without having to wait.   This location is clean which is a good thing.   Staff was friendly and the customer service great.
author: Marck N.

description: This is my go to Starbucks when I'm craving a Holiday drinks and the more mundane espresso drinks at the office just aren't cutting it. The baristas here are really nice, and the one time my pick up order was done incorrectly, I didn't notice until I returned to the office. When I did bring it back they were exceptionally nice about it! And quickly made me a new one.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Have visited here a handful of times over the last few months and have never been disappointed. The customer service is wonderful in this Starbucks. They are so friendly and accommodating here, you just can't go wrong! Kaz was amazing! 

Keep it up
author: Faizan D.

description:
Kaz was awesome! I ordered online to the wrong shop and as soon as I realized that she offered to make my drink. 

Long wait in store at peak hours.
author: Brit M.

description: This location can whip up a drink during the morning rush like nobody's biz. Feeling sleepy?  Get a quad flat white (or even just a regular), and you will feel like you're superman/woman for the remainder of the day. Sure, it's a major chain and yeah, it's Starbucks, but the staff here are super friendly and fast, and can brighten your morning, even the toughest ones like Mondays. Super convenient loc as well, and right outside the doorstep of the Palace Hotel.
author: Alison A.

description:
I'm writing this from the queue, having already spent 10 minutes waiting on line. TEN. At a STARBUCKS. There were only about 5 people ahead of me when I got here. 

The point of a chain is that they're all the same, except for the service. The employees seem perfectly nice, but damn this place takes forever for a cup of coffee. There are at least two other Starbucks within 2 - 3 blocks. Don't come to this one unless you have no plans for the rest of the day.

Update: still waiting at the time of this posting
author: Al I.

description:
A relatively large Starbucks in the middle of downtown. Yes it's quite large on the inside, but unfortunately not a lot of seats--most of the room is filled up by empty space.

Because of the location, there are often folks who come in, sit without buying anything, and sometimes even just "doze off" in their seats for long periods of time.

Wifi is not bad--it can get slow if there are lots of customers, but even then it's faster than I would have expected. The coffee is also consistent.

Can't complain.
author: Henry L.

description:
Receive my tea in record time ! Antonio was great in offering customer service! 

The quiet atmosphere makes it a great place to relax and get work done.
author: Austin P.

description: I'll add to what previous reviewers have said. It's a very inefficient team and they take forever to prepare everything, creating a long queue. Once I was done waiting, I asked for a 10-person traveler. The cashier looked at who seemed to be the manager and said "she needs a traveler". The manager answered "it will be 30 minutes." 30 minutes! It takes around 10 minutes to get a traveler usually. I promptly left and went to the closest Starbucks on Stevenson and 2nd. Currently here and waiting for my Traveler which will be ready in 10 minutes...
author: Doriane M.

description:
Recently renovated Starbucks to create more space for seating and regulate the ordering line. Pro tip: unlike the old cafe model pre-remodeling, you need to go to the end of the cafe to get in line. I see people wait and lines start forming at the pick-up area sometimes. They should put a sign up with an arrow directing people. 

SETTING
-Newly renovated cafe looks and feels brighter due to the new wallpaper. I like it!
-Lots of small tables and high chair / booths for you to drink your coffee at.
-Pro tip #2 - there are outlets under the bar table!!! Students, travelers, people in need of electric juice, goooo here! This is one of the more spacious Starbucks in the city.
-Staff seems friendly and helpful. I've never had a problem an order at this location. 

What else... currently they are having a sale for their cold drink merchandise! Besides all of that - everyone should register their Starbucks gift card. Every purchase earns you a star and every 12 stars earns you a free drink!! You have nothing to lose :) 

Thanks 74 Montgomery Starbucks for your delicious chai lattes :9
author: Grace J.

description:
This is one of about 1100 Starbucks on or Market Street. It is a block from the Palace Hotel, which made it super convenient for me, as a Palace guest.
Despite being a fairly small store, and really crowded, the line moved quickly and the baristas were super cheerful. They deserve an extra star for being that cheerful at 0730 on a Friday morning.
author: Lou P.

description: Lines can be long but it's the closest to work so I'll stop by here a few times a week. Jason and Milton are usually working the front, and they're very friendly. Some of the other workers here are a bit snippy and could use a smile from time to time. I know it should go without saying, but this location never messes up my order and they're pretty quick. It's experiences at stores like these that make me come back (even if i have to deal with the crappy ones by my house) to the BUX.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Exactly, "meh, I've experienced better."

My americano tasted as if it was brewed with day-old grounds, possibly chock full o' nuts brand. 

Coffee cake was tasty, but the texture through my off. Think earthworm in bread.
author: S D.

description: Really bad green tea latte, tons of powder stuck on the top of lid being not fully mixed
author: Hannah C.

description: Favorite Starbucks downtown. Quick staff and very clean store. The staff are friendly, upbeat and very efficient. There's ample room for seating and this location is quiet enough to get work done. Bonus it has a clean bathroom!
author: Lynsey S.

description: Yes, this location is close to work, which makes it very convenient.  Their staff is friendly and I think they do a good job of moving people through the line, since this Starbucks can get very crowded.  The barista's here do a nice job.  I also like the new look after their renovation.  I also can't recall them ever messing-up my drink order, so that's worth a lot in my book.
author: Lon H.

description:
Perks of working by Montgomery BART...this Starbucks is literally right downstairs for when you need your mid-morning caffeine jolt. I stress mid-morning because it's a rather crazy wait if you come in around the 8-9am rush. I will only do that when I know I have at least 15 minutes to spare before work. 

About this particular location -- all the drinks are made decently. I haven't had any issues with drinks being too cold or hot, running out of ingredients, or constant misspelling of my name. I would give it 4 stars if there wasn't always a wait! (Sometimes I just give up and end up going to Peet's instead). 

The plus side is the staff are REALLY NICE. They will personally bring out your pastry/bagel, even when it's crowded. They will apologize if your drink is running late. The barista with the spot-on makeup (who looks like she works for Sephora) is really friendly and makes sure you get a hot sample of a drink when they're running promos.

Things to note:
- Long lines during peak coffee drinking times
- Plenty of tables to do work, have meetings, or eat lunch 
- Spotty wi-fi. I always have trouble connecting via AT&T hotspot and when I turn off wi-fi, I still can't connect through my data plan.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
This place is gigantic especially compared to the Peets right around the corner. My phone was dying and I desperately needed an outlet to charge it so I was extremely happy when I stumbled into this Starbucks and quickly found an empty seat with an outlet right next to it. 

I like Starbucks because the employees are super chill and let you charge your phone/use their wifi without purchasing anything unlike at local family owned coffee shops.
author: Carolyn C.

description: Have been to many Starbucks location but this is one of my favorites. Even during busy times the staff is friendly and professional. I get green tea frappuccino there all the time and never was disappointed with imy drink even once.
author: Yoobi L.

description:
Very fast service considering were this Starbucks is located and how busy they are. my only knock on this place is that both times i have been there they just can not understand my name. Sarmad is not a common name i understand but this part of SF downtown is filled with engineers and software developers from India and Pakistan. Every other person in Starbucks was Indian on the days I went in here. If that is the case should you not used to be hearing Indian and Pakistani names? The last time i was there the guy asked from my name and ignored what i said and just put "flash" on the cup since i was wearing a flash t-shirt. I didn't mind that much I just think it is strange that they are not making an effort to get to know their customer base. 

I frequent other Starbucks in the bay area and most of them always make an effort to say my name. I understand they are a chain but quite frankly i expect better from Starbucks because i get good services at other locations i go to. 

The customized chai latte I ordered itself was good. Made well and fast.
author: Sarmad N.

description:
Cute location, but awful customer service. (Unless, of course, you are a young blonde.) The young brown-haired male that worked on V-day yesterday had the nerve to argue with me about how "I" want my drink. First he told me to read the sign, then he said, aloud, but to a co-worker, "She can't read." Of course, I asked him if he was talking about me. Of course, he shut right up.

I stopped frequenting Starbucks several years ago, because their coffee is too bitter and they are too big of a monopoly here in the Bay Area. I've been visiting for the past week, because I had a gift card to use up and I like their new "flat white" beverage (even though they still don't have almond milk).  

Bye, again, Sbux.
author: Felicia P.

description:
Dear Starbucks at 74 New Montgomery Street,

I've tried.  I really have.  And it's not you, it's me.  I just can't seem to figure out what I've done for you to treat me this way.  Nevertheless, there are many Starbucks fish in the sea and a trip around the block provides me with the Starbucks of my dreams who is kind and can give me what I want in a timely manner.  I thought the longer than normal wait for my normal cup of coffee and unfriendly staff was an accident, a one time thing, a bad day, a new worker, but time and time again I have had the same experience.  I've got to claim some self-esteem and walk away, my darling.
author: Allyson D.

description:
Highlights
- One of the larger Starbucks that I have been to in the downtown area. 
- Plenty of seating, a lot more spacious than some others, and more offerings in terms of drinkware and goodies. 
- A lot more food items too, since they have about double the amount of window display for food items compared to some other locations. 
- I like that this location allows me plenty of space to wait for my drink, rather than having to stand awkwardly in what little space there is and having other patrons think that I am still in line. 

Improvements
- With more space, it amounts to more people that frequent this location. Averaging about 5 or so people to even 10+ ahead of me on weekday mornings. (It does go by pretty quick though). 

Tip
- Check out their drink specials on the chalkboard. If you encounter something you like, get it while it lasts. I wish some items would be available all year round.
author: Tracy T.

description: Another great Starbucks. I am here 4 times a week, and they are always fast and friendly. I love Annie she is such a joy to talk to every morning. My drink, which is not just off the board, is always made deliciously. A great start to my morning.
author: Kid D.

description:
Just blabbering ... and wondering ...

Good service

Nice service  ... it was Sat mid noon
But, they were still great service.
Rarely do you find Starbuck with wait staff

Had the pleasure to tryout the powermat

Starbucks ... what's more to say
other than the size of the store ...

lobby,   tiny takout,   small,      medium,    large store or I could say
lobby  , tall,               grande,   venti,         Buri

This place is VENTI sized

I must be bored ... 
I don't review Starbucks aka
   cookie cutter coffeehouse ... was bored...

I wish they have serveral different interior store design
   3 or more and rotate,  would have been fine... they all look alike ...
   they could shove some local colors or design
author: S.K. Y.

description:
I'm actually a Starbucks fan -- decent coffee available virtually anywhere with quick courteous service. I just stopped for a quick to go cup of Sumatra on my way to BART from a business lunch in SOMA.  It took 20 minutes after I got to the front of the line and the barista was completely flustered because they had run out! It doesn't take 20 minutes to brew a new pot... If the store had been busy, I'd be more understanding. In Seattle this store would be looking for a new shift manager -- maybe a new manager!

I did get an apology, but I would have walked out if I hadn't already paid for the drink.
author: Mark O.

description: Rude white Mexican girl cashier and forget making my order sometime, other than her everyone been nice:)
author: 天雪

description:
We basically all know what to expect food/drink wise when we go to Starbs, so I am going to review this solely based on customer service, location, ect... Because we all know Starbucks coffee does not get 5 stars alone ;)
Anywaysss, I went to this Starbucks this morning during a work break and was pleasantly surprised. The man taking my order was so hospitable and friendly. He was asking me how my day was going and if I had a long commute. He honestly brightened my day and Starbucks experience. 
The location and set up of this store is prime. It's located on a corner in the financial district, but also close to SoMa. There's lots of seating and different types of seating (tables and chairs, bar, comfy seats). You can also charge your phone at the tables using these plugins they provide. So great if you need to charge up your phone while sipping on your coffee and getting work done.
Very thankful that this Starbucks is right across the street from my work!
author: Katrina L.

description: I like the new order ahead feature but the woman driving it up (4:03 in the afternoon on Saturday 10/17 ) couldn't be ruder.  Nearly bit my head off when I asked about my preorder.  Don't need that attitude.  Need to get better quality help Starbucks.
author: Jimmy K.

description: I'm always start my day by Starbucks dark roast coffee. Today, Monday, November 9th, 2015 around 11:00am I ordered Grande dark roast coffee, the young white male guy told me it's Thanksgiving blend dark roast coffee and I said no problem cause I know the TG blend taste  (it's seasonal) and this guy he started fill up the pike, I told him I need the dark roast, not a pike and he was like 'sorry' and finally he gave me a decaf coffee ( como'n yo I know the taste and I need some coffin in the morning) I tried it and  I was like it's better if I go to d/t Starbucks location. I'm just curious WHY?
author: Gize A.

description:
This Starbucks is big. It gets a lot of foot traffic. 

This Starbucks is a well oiled machine. With TWO huge pastry cases and a herd of staff, please know what you want when you step up to the ordering plate, because the line is typically about 20 people deep and we all want to be in and out and on our way. 

The restrooms are for customers only which is a plus. It is a good location which is a plus. They always have a pastry assortment which is a mega plus. And the staff sorta kinda remembers you if you go there enough which is a plus - especially considering how many grouchy faces they see on a daily basis. 

I prefer this location to the one around the corner which is smaller and not as busy, mainly because of the selection and that even with all of the people it doesn't feel claustrophobic.
author: Katie K.

description: The staff was nice, there was quite a line and I waited about 5 minutes for a frappucino but that's pretty standard at 3:30pm on a weekday in FiDi.  I was just in and out but if I had wanted to find a place to sit down, there weren't really any open seats. Overall, solid Starbs experience.  I will be back.
author: Hannah C. R.

description:
I'm a firm believer that people come in and out of your life for a reason. (and though I know I've probably included this sentence in a number of my reviews now - please bear with me)

Yesterday, my co-worker was craving something sweet. I was just about to run an errand, so I offered to grab her something. She asked if I'd pick her up a light Frappocino (sp?).

I used to regularly pop into this Starbucks location - when our office was closer - with the much missed Richard T.  I always appreciated the warm casual vibe, and the diversity of people who'd hang out here. A nice mixture of art students and people who work in the area.

As I stared long and hard at the Starbucks board of drinks yesterday, the girl behind the counter - smiled real big and asked what I was listening to.  One side of my headphones dangling round my neck.

I sighed real heavy.

"I dunno - Joe Purdy - real good - but kinda depressing stuff."

She frowned a little.

"Why? It's so nice out."

I nodded.

"Yeah - I should prob put some more upbeat music on."

I didn't. 

But as I grabbed that cold Starbucks drink and made my way back to the office - I noticed the sun. Felt it through my thick hoodie.

And later on that night - as I caught up with an old friend on the phone - laughing about the past, I thought about that random Starbucks encounter and put on some faint music in the background. Still Joe Purdy - but it didn't sound so down. The lyrics sounded hopeful. And i even boogied a little to one of his songs as I made my way through my appallingly messy room.

So yeah - this Starbucks rocks. Good pastry selection. Plenty of seating room. And wise. Oh so wise servers.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: I just moved into a nearby office building, so it was important to visit the closest Starbucks to check it out since I'd be there a lot.  This is actually one of my favorites so far.  It's SUPER spacious, clean, and the staff has been extra nice to me each of the three times I visited.  Additionally, there are several other starbuck's around, so this reduces the traffic in a spot that I thought would create more of a line.  Each time I've ordered and received my drink in less than 3 minutes.  Super clutch.  I'm stoked.  This starbucks rocks.  A++
author: Bradley H.

description: Your typical downtown Starbucks. They are fast-paced and know how to crank out your coffee/treats in a timely fashion. Just quick enough to get you on your way to work.
author: Melissa S.

description:
If you're walking down New Mont. towards Mission and you see a line of people. Don't even bother going in. They tend to only have 1 person making drinks even when there are like 5 people working at the same time.

FYI: There's always the same bum standing right outside of this SBUX.
author: Shawn B.

description: When rating a Starbucks I always start out at 3 stars and adjust accordingly.  This one has the typical options available and the staff was always decent, but the consistently slow internet and sticky tables made me want to go somewhere else.
author: Andreas H.

description:
Posting this from inside once again.  The wireless hasn't dropped yet, but there are limited number of outlets.  There is a sofa section, that looks pretty comfortable, but it's been full since I got here and there doesn't seem to be any outlets.  

There is a creepy guy staring at me while I type this...  

I'll go back to the Starbucks on third st. next time.
author: Richard T.

description: Yes this one I can give 4 stars on this visit, came here for a personal business meeting and needed a clean place to use WIFI and a good cup of cofee, this place met both of my expectations, mind you this was a on saturday afternoon, if this had been a weekday probably would have had only 3 stars because it would have been packed, I was there on a Saturday so we had an uncrowded end of the table, the WIFI was decent, and got the bizness done.  Restroom was reasonably clean, a block away from Montgomery Bart..
author: Wil G.

description:
Plenty of seating from indoor and outside. The inside feels very warm and cozy. They also offer ice water that you can pour out yourself. I love that!

They also have a bathroom with a password. I like these bathrooms because it means they are cleaner than the open bathrooms. 

The downside was the slowness of the service. It was like 5pm and I ordered a drink. The barista was chatting it up with a friend and took longer than normal for me to get my drink even though I was the only one who was waiting.
author: Sarah C.

description: They used to be fast in the morning, now it's painfully slow post-remodel. Long lines and only one person working the register. No one pre-orders drinks for those in line like at other locations. Luckily (?) there are 3 other Starbucks within a 2-block radius.
author: Michael M.

description:
yes, it's a starbucks, but it's so much more to me. I attend Academy of Art and work at the school's library near this starbucks. This is the best customer service I have EVER gotten... any where. Maybe it's because at some points during the semester I was showing up 3-4 times a day (all-nighters plus 8am-10pm schedules excluding commutes), but they quickly caught onto my name. They also have recommended beverages that I have come to love. I tend to change my drink so they often still have to ask, but they at least know my main selections. The best part, is that even on their breaks, the employees are really nice and friendly. I also tend to prefer how they make their drinks at this location than any other location I've been to ( sadly, I've been to a lot and, yes, the drinks taste different from store to store.)

The one issue I have is that I have had to cut back on my starbucks for budgeting reasons, so I usually catch the employees when they are the most busy. (the rush times are usually based on class schedules, which means around 8am,12pm, 3pm, & 6pm). When it's not really busy, I usually get to talk to whom ever is the barista at the time.
author: Joanna A.

description:
They didn't accept my Starbucks coupon. :( The coupon states, "Indulge in a free tall hazelnut or caramel Macchiato. Our special treat just for you." Liees.... No where on the coupon states this can't be used. 

Baristas weren't rude about it or anything, but still an over poor experience for me trying to get a "special treat"
author: Christopher S.

description:
This Starbucks is quite alright. There's always this very sassy young gentlemen, but he calls out the orders quickly and efficiently.

It's usually pretty fast despite the numerous customers that range from business people to AAU students.
author: Rinslet W.

description:
One of the bigger Starbucks in town. Nothing too special about it - standard drinks and fare, friendly service. There's a server, a middle-aged Asian lady, who always seems to know regular customers and their order - quite an impressive memory! It's in a busier part of town so the lines can be quite long, but they move fairly quickly.

I really like how they have a lot of tables - great for studying.
author: Julia H.

description: Pass by this everyday but finally went in to get a latte with a friend. It was BOGO for their holiday drinks and I got the chestnut flavored latte. The barista was friendly and quick with service. The place just went through a renovation and is a bit more spacious, with lots of window counters for you to write your blogs or just chat. Not a bad place to hang out in SOMA if you're waiting for someone.
author: William H.

description: Relatively large Starbucks with plenty of seating. During the mornings or lunch time, this place gets pretty crowded. However, the baristas keep the line moving despite how many people are in line.
author: Rachel C.

description: I've been to this Starbucks a few times and I'm a big fan of it compared to the ones on 3rd St. This Starbucks is a *lot* more empty at 7am in the morning, and seating is always plentiful. The staff here are very nice to deal with despite it being 7am in the morning which you don't always see. Internet is fast, though like other Starbucks locations, outlets are rare.
author: Austin W.

description:
This Starbucks is one of the good ones I think, although I haven't had the coffee here. I tend to stop in with others or to pick up a quick bottle of water or some soothing chamomile tea. However, haven't heard any complaints. It's quite busy, being next to the Academy and all, but the staff seem to handle all that just as well. 

The Verdict: While many Starbucks can be hit or miss, this one is mighty fine.
author: Cara S.

description:
I love this location of starbucks. Their baristas are always on top of their game. i've never had a crappy or screwed up drink!

Always have fresh good, friendly, and pretty quick despite the crazy crowds!
author: Karen L.

description:
Came here to eat my sushi+burrito because they don't have any seats inside sushiritto. I ordered a coffee for my friend and a grande black tea lemonade for myself. The lady who was making my drink said it was going to take a couple minutes to make my drink and I said that was fine. She told the cashier not to charge me so I only paid for my friends drink. Later when my order was up she gave me a venti instead. I don't know why I got it for free but THANKS!!!! 

I think this starbucks is better than the two in union square cause theres never seats available in those. This one probably has 2-3 times as many seats.
author: Sean W.

description: The staff at 74 New Montgomery is friendly enough. I've seen livelier at other places, though. The place is well lit and clean, especially after being remodeled. The internet is SLOW, though. Doesn't seem like a place to get things done. It's more like a place to hang out and be seen.
author: Randy M.

description:
This Starbucks is awesome for the most part.  I've been coming here for years, as I teach at the University on the same block.  The team is happy, always polite, and chews-up the line like pros.  The really do their best amidst such an intense environment, and I am amazed at their composure... for the most part.

There's just one thing:  The little hyper lady who constantly SCREAMS at you/her co-workers right next to her/people not even paying attention to her while waiting for their latte at 8AM on a Monday.  

"HI HOW ARE YOU!?!? IT'S PUMPKIN BREAD!!  YOU WANT PUMPKIN BREAD INSTEAD OF THE THING YOU ORDER?  OKAY, THANK YOU SO MUCH.  HELLO SIR, YOU WANT PUMPKIN BREAD?!?!..... *Repeat for 30 minutes over and over again*"

I mean, she even screams out when she's talking to herself............ 

You can't talk on the phone, hear the person you are in conversation with, or even hear yourself think.  This is Starbucks... not the Giants game. 

In any case, This Starbucks is still my favorite; a great team and great location.

LV
author: Lawrence V.

description: I had a chicken panini. I felt that the bread was not fresh. I think it was because I had it at around 12:30 pm. My guess is it is fresher in the morning. There was no rush when I went there. The sitting area is big.
author: Harshal J.

description:
I only come to this Starbucks because I work a block a way.  Starbucks is my last choice, if Cafe Madeline doesn't have my chocolate croissant in the morning. 

I spend to much time at Starbucks in the morning. Especially the long wait to order, processing the order, making the order and actually getting it in hand. 

The black coffee isn't strong, the americano taste EXTREMELY watered down and sometimes my caramel machiato or caramel frap doesn't have caramel.  SMH! 

By the time I find out, I am already in the office.  My CRAZY coworker had walked back multiple times in getting her order fixed. Yikes,. 

I will be back,. because I have to!
author: Chanel L.

description: Why can't be a negative star?! The service is terrible than any SB I've ever went! The waiter is flirting with the waitress and they ignored there's a long line, doing their own stuffs here and there. I asked them to make my coffee now but they delayed and delayed... So disappointed...
author: Lisa C.

description: Friendly service with PLENTY of seating
author: Miran C.

description:
I've been going to Starbucks for years, and I've been going to this location regularly since I started working nearby. I've been here at least 30 times and I can say with certainty that this location has horrible customer service. The main reason I even buy this marked up coffee is because the customer service is usually fast and very good... but not at this location. 

I didn't have a particularly bad experience but I'm less happy when I leave then when I entered. The baristas are generally unfriendly, they usually don't look you in the eye, they don't say please or thank you, some of them will just hold out their hand for your money without saying anything, they are REALLY SLOW and do not give a crap (as another Yelp reviewer here said), and there's a really loud and shrill female asian barista whose voice annoys the heck out of me. One time a woman came in who didn't know the names of the sizes and they the baristas were very impatient with her and just not nice about it, like WTF.

I think that whoever manages this location just doesn't care about who they hire, I don't know.
author: Lori L.

description:
This is my go-to Starbucks on the way to work. Someday they might remember who I am...but I get a tall coffee (bold) almost every time, so I guess they don't have to ask for my name. I think they make tasty, strong coffee (though I think it tastes better earlier in the morning). Service is always friendly and fast.

If they remember who I am, then I will give them 5 stars. Is that asking too much? 

...maybe...
author: Katelyn M.

description:
Location is great.  Customer service is horrible.

If a barista can't understand my drink order (which by the way is easily understood at other Starbucks locations), they don't have to be belittling or rude about it.  It must be the "barista culture" at this place.

I've ordered the same drink 4 different times.  They got the order correct only once.  I'm very patient.  And so I didn't complain.  But I also feared they would still get my drink order wrong.
author: Krystal Nina L.

description: Great place to take a break and use the free WiFi especially since I don't have data.  It's very close to a bus stop too.
author: XiaoChuan Y.

description:
Here is my take on the Starbucks vs. Peet's brouhaha. There is only a brouhaha if you choose to have one. What I mean is, they both have meticulous attention to what they offer, make, brew and serve. They both have interesting design inside, sweet laid back ambiance, and (now) free wifi. They both train their employees to consistently provide their best possible crafted drinks. The employees are extremely well trained. 

That all being said, I love coming in to this Starbucks for all of the above reasons. Also, if I come here 3 to 4 times a week, I will develop a first name greeting from the barrista on duty. And me Mister Terrible with names, saying hi back. It is heart warming in this huge city to be greeted by name. Give me a tall (12 oz.) dark roast with room for cream, please. 

Aaaaah.
author: Jimbob P.

description: This is a pretty spacious location where you can get some work done on your computer or grab a cup to chat with your friend.  There's pretty ample seating at this location.
author: Mel G.

description:
Here right now.

Whenever I come here, they're really slow and it's always incedibly packed from students or local workers. They aren't good with morning rush hour or lunch/break rushes either...

They always get my order wrong or forget to ring me up as well. Why the f*ck is there just 2 people working? Do you guys not realize the line goes OUT the door?!
author: Mimi N.

description:
I get my morning coffee here every morning, not only because its the closest Stabucks to my work, but they have the best baristas in town.  I'm very picky with my coffee, and so far the barista here have been doing a great job fulfilling my caffeine fix.  Yes, this place does get busy being that is it across the street from the Academy of Art and next door to the Palace Hotel, but service is fast and of course, friendly. 
Sometimes an occasional homeless person will come in and buy a cup of coffee and scare some customers away, but hey its SF they're all over.. what do you expect, let the man get his coffee.....
author: Emmett B.

description:
Ah.. the famous Starbucks empire. They've grown from that wee lil unassuming coffee shop in Seattle, WA to a global conglomerate. I heard they've done collaborated with music recording artists and have gone out to produce their own record label. Fact or myth? 

I've been a faithful Starbucks fan for a good 7+ years. I went through a phase when my all-time choice of beverage was the Grande Caramel Frappucino. Now, I've grown up... a whole 2 waist sizes bigger (JK), and I've moved up the into the "adult drinks." I like to pride myself on the fact that I NO LONGER get the girly drinks like Strawberry Frap, but have now embraced more mature, manlier drinks: Americano, double espresso. Though I do like my occasional White Choco Mocha (and it's seasonal kin: Peppermint White Choco Mocha), I stick to my adult drinks to keep me awake while I slave away in my adult job. 

I would rate this location a 4 or higher, but the employees keep me from doing it. They are consistently out of items (hot chocolate, muffins, breakfast items, etc.) and sometimes they don't have enough employees to accommodate the morning, afternoon, or evening rush. Helo?!? Stop wasting your money away on opening up new locations (I'm sure 15,012 in 44 countries **thanks Wikipedia** will be enough for now) and start focusing on your CURRENT stores!

Bottom line: Starbucks does a good job to suck you in and get you to spend $4/beverage, only to find you getting into your gas-guzzling luxury sports car, and complain about $3 gas prices. Look buddy, you just spent $4 on a damn 16 oz cup of sugar-laden toxic death! LOL. Save me from my sugar high and hand me my insulin please...
author: Carloalexi M.

description: I have been coming to this SX forever. I have more checkins for other locations because Yelp and 4Square both lag to show this location so after checking into wrong SX by mistake I realized may be I SHOULD do it on purpose? I do. One big store. Has communal table and window bar seating and tables by window inside and outside and couch back seating. Line literally goes 20 or more people. They are good. Staff know everybody and are good. Once in a while a homeless or crazy person comes in grabbing coffee bags to run. Sometimes caught and other times eludes everyone. The rest is just SX.
author: Cush D.

description:
Now that I know my locals here and can feel the flow I'm happier coming here, and the location is extremely convenient!

My only qualm is quite often I want to grab one the protein packs either for breakfast or for a snack, and they never seem to have it!

Also, and I' not sure if this is a starbucks in general thing or maybe just this location, but I recently ordered the sausage egg and cheese muffin thing for breakfast, and it was the first time I've ever tried it, but it was really salty, I wasn't able to finish more than half of it.

Apart from that, the staff are friendly here, the know their shit when it comes to remembering customers and their drinks, and it's generally a fast service.  Of course if I come at 8:15am or 3:00pm I know I'm going to be here for at least 20-30 minutes, but I guess that's why I don't got there during those time frames.
author: Kym P.

description: Worst mocha frappuccino of my life. Donno how they managed to mess it up so bad. Tasted like death. Breakfast sandwich was ok.
author: Bryan H.

description:
T-E-R-R-I-B-L-E.

First off the cashier screamed out someone's name and even louder yelled out that their card had been declined. How rude and how embarrassing for the poor client whose card worked fine but just wasn't read correctly by the machine....have some tact for pete's sake.

Second, my sandwich wasn't heated up long enough so although the outer edges were warm, the egg white at the middle was ice cold....disgusting. 

Lastly...WHAT IS UP WITH YOUR INTERNET?!? I can't even open an email on gmail because the connection is so slow. I purchased food and drink so I could get some work done only to find out your Internet is essentially non existant.

Get it together Starbucks on New Montgomery...this is absolutely ridiculous and 100% unacceptable.
author: Anna-Alexia B.

description: This Starbucks is frequented by lots of students and so I was prepared to wait a bit to get my pumpkin steamer. I was surprised to be met by no line (though this was not the case by the time I was walking out). The employees are very nice and this location has lots of seating. You may have to repeat your order a few times but other than that, no complaints!
author: H T.

description: for a financial district starbucks..the line moves pretty fast, but there is usually always a long line. the people who work here are very friendly. this place just got remolded, but the wifi sucks.
author: Yumna B.

description: I love this Starbucks! Since it's located across the street from my school and a block away from my apartment, I'm usually here every day. The baristas are really friendly, and they know how to keep the line moving when it gets really busy. There is plenty of seating and outlets to plug in your laptop. I just wish they had some more comfortable seating, like plush chairs or a couch, but this location is really narrow so the space doesn't really allow for it. Other than that, this Starbucks is a winner!
author: Stephanie H.

description:
I'm the kind of person who will repeatedly go back somewhere, even if I had a bad experience a couple of times. I used to work at Starbucks for 3 years so I have a general idea of what the baristas should treat you like. I also attend AAU right across the street, which was the only reason why I would go here. I have to say, they have a great location ... and that's about it.
I would GLADLY walk all the way to the 3rd and Market street Starbucks to get away from this horrible service. Not only have I had people roll their eyes because my drink was not what I asked for (eg. green tea when I asked for black, or short instead of tall) but I have also had the misfortune of them being blatantly rude and making my drink poorly because I politely asked for my correct drink.

The day that I finally decided not to go there again was in May and I have not gone there since. I figure it's about time I told you all why.
The drink order was simple enough, a tall caramel macchiato. The first error was made when a short cup was grabbed. She called it out as a tall drink.
Now, I am really understanding, and I honestly don't care if you mess up a little on my drink. I told her, "Oops, I ordered a tall. Don't worry about it, just put it in a tall cup, add a little more milk and it's fine."
She replied by dumping it out. "No, I have to start over."
I wasn't in a huge hurry, but I did have to meet up with someone. My boyfriend, who has unlimited patience, was looking at his watch. This was due to the fact that she had now made the milk and shots, and was letting them both sit separately as she made other people's drinks. Then she poured the now dead shots into the foam and covered it with caramel. She proceeded to make other people's drinks before she finally put the lid on it and hand it out to me. It was in-your-face RUDE! To be honest, I didn't want her to make my drink again. I threw it out after we left.

The most irritating part was that she was so angry at me the entire time and was not talkative, smiling, or polite. She was glaring the whole time. ?!?! WHY?? Certainly it couldn't have been due to me asking for my real drink!?

I have had the WORST service here of ANY Starbucks. I have had men here scoff at me for asking for the syrup that was supposed to be in my drink, people getting irritated at me when they give me the WRONG pastry, and dead shots WHICH CAN BE PREVENTED IF YOU GET THEM IN THE MILK BEFORE 11 SECONDS IS UP!! I always try to say PLEASE and THANK YOU, even though more than half the time I get a grunt in return.

I am not asking for the baristas to be perfect, because I certainly am not. All I would like is when someone is being polite, just be polite back.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Yeah, I know this is a review for a chain store, but this review is so much more. I want to highlight the great service at this particular location. Over the past 3 or 4 years, I have come in here several times a week to get my usual coffee and breakfast fixe, and the staff here never disappoints. They are always upbeat cheerful, and I don't think I've ever come across a questionable retail moment with the staff. This is also a very large location with many benches, sofas, and bar stools for you to drink, use free wifi or people watch. Cheers!
author: Michael C.

description:
Surely this Starbucks is prime FIDI location.

During peak hours, 7-9AM, expect your drink(s) to be made wrong not to mention the crazy line that goes out the door.

The baristas at this location are not professional nor can they work fast. 

I love the space and layout of this store but I'd rather walk another 3 blocks to get my coffee elsewhere!
author: Keiko C.

description: DO NOT GO HERE if you're expecting good customer service.  Only go here if you want to be schooled in the official Starbucks refill policy.  If you want good customer service go to the one at 333 Market or 199 Fremont.  I've been a long time Starbucks customer but at the point that they want to haggle over a few ounces of iced tea when I spend $10 per day, then I'll take my business elsewhere.
author: Ken S.

description: This Starbucks is more comfortable to hang out compared to the one near Metreon.  I got a good cup of cappuccino, so I probably will be back for future afternoon coffee and tea.
author: Steven M.

description: This Starbucks was my place of refuge while I was attending Academy of Art (across the street). Yes, it does get VERY busy on weekdays, but it's not as if everyone comes here for no good reason. The service is efficient and very friendly, and the atmosphere is clean and comfortable, with plenty of seating. Even if the line was out the door, usually I was able to make it back in time for class, thanks to the quick service. Thank you, New Montgomery Starbucks, for keeping me (somewhat) sane.
author: Katie M.

description:
Always clean, always friendly. Always a line but the wait is never long for some reason. They are a well-oiled machine at this location!

My ONLY gripe is the girl who yells orders (she's short, asian, but really nice- so I feel bad). She kind of ruins the whole coffee experience for me. Like I said, I feel bad- but her voice is extremely obnoxious at 8am when you're trying to get your fix.
author: Amy B.

description:
The only reason that people should buy coffee at Starbucks in San Francisco is because Starbucks is the closest place to get your morning caffeine rush.  

I am not on the anti-globalization/anti-Starbucks bandwagon (although I think there are many ways in which globalization should be reconceptualized, I also don't think that Starbucks is the worst corporation on earth... there's stiff competition for that).

But I am a genuine coffee lover, and hands down, Peets wins.  (Yes, Ritual is better than Peets, of course... but when you are working in SOMA, you have Peets or Starbucks).  

Starbucks is making some efforts.  Recently, there was an article about Starbucks finally realizing how bad their food is and deciding to add new food items (there is nothing more deceptive than a Starbucks pastry...looking so yummy and buttery, yet in actuality tasting oh so dry).  

However, have they realized how bad their cappuccino is? Or their latte?  

Most days, I go to Peets (Ritual is reserved for the weekends).  However, there are the random days when I am stuck in a town without a Peets.  I am looking forward to the day when I can find Peets in any town.  In the meantime, I will continue to go to Starbucks when I have to, all the while wishing there was a Peets closer by.
author: Sooj O.

description:
ok i have a huge adversion to coffee. I have barely drinken the shit in the last ten years sincerely. Then I started school, and Ive had those moments lately where I need to wake the fuck up.

enter this starbucks, which is right by my thursday classes at 180 NM.

I get foofy things, im into soy caramel macchiatos, or right now they have a seasonal pumpkin latte and i handle that soy wise too(im totally on the soy train ).

So basically im drinking this crap once a week. the staff here is nice and I feel for them because not only do they have to deal with the lame academy students trying to be deep, they also have to deal with financial district douches, and tourists from the palace hotel.
author: Lauren V.

description:
Does another Starbucks location really need another review? No, probably not. 

I hate the door to this place! And it's my own stupidity. The handful of times I've gone in here, I end up looking like it's the first time that my keepers let me into the general population. The front door opens in. That is, when you're on the street, you push. Folks, this is contrary to all of my intrinsic door-opening knowledge. I tried to open the door for someone coming out with a cup in each hand and yanked on the thing four times, staring at the part that says "PUSH." I know, I know...it's labeled right in front of me, but it just doesn't click in my head! 

If you're here---at New Montgomery and Mission---looking for coffee, please cross the street and go to Cafe Madeleine. Do it. 'Cause I said so. And you won't look like a dork like me. 

So, two stars because they serve caffeine. And, some days, that's all that gets me to function.
author: Erin M.

description:
The staff here is always happy and ready to try to please their customers.  There is not too much turnover in the staff so they start remembering their customers preferences.  It is always nice to be remembered.

There is one employee during their busy hours that does nothing but clean up and keep the condiment bar refreshed.  It is good to know that there will always be cream available when you are in a rush.

I wish they would put more attention on non-customers sleeping in the store.
author: Bart V.

description:
Why am I yelping a Starbucks when:

1. I hate chain stores
2. I don't drink coffee
3.  Did I mention I hate chain stores?

I needed to give a shout out to Justine who works there.  I don't have internet access at home.  Shocking, I know but wait, I don't own a computer.  So when I had to work over the weekend and send some emails out, I was clueless on how to get access to the wifi.  
Thank goodness for Justine who instead of charging 5 bucks for a couple hours of wifi, she let me use her log in.  

She's a sweetheart.  Please tip her big time.  

Justine, thank you sista!
author: Monica L.

description:
Wow... i love how the girl below me writes half of her review on the doors opening inward... too much.

Well to start off I work here, but hear me out. I would have given this location 4 stars (out of 5) before I worked here. If anything, working here would lower stars in my book, It did with almost every other place I have worked.

The door situation isn't starbucks fault, if used to open outward but then the city said the traffic into the building was causing traffing on the sidewalk to change course when people open and closed the door... deal with it, it is clearly labled.

Starbucks is YES a corporation and blah blah, but it still searves a great product. Other little coffee shops may searve coffee in a cuter more "we're small and lonely" type way, but the taste of the product is what you want. I personally like starbucks, it's consistent no matter where in the country i go, and the company is a nice comapny who cares about it's employees and the community. What other coffee shop can you go to where they will give the part timers benifits? And also if you work there, you can donate money to charity and starbucks will match your donation. That's a good company.

Ehh, if you don't like starbucks you have already stopped reading this, so hello to the rest, and come see me working there, I feel like my whole life is spent in there.

For tea though, go around the corner to Peets! AMAZING tea!
author: Preston B.

description:
I like it! :]
Good service. Fun and fast.
Yay!
Upside down Soy caramel machiattio! 
that or a Green tea lemonade! GTL ftw....
author: Evan Y.

description:
I went to a lot of starbucks in the city and this one is by far the worst I tried.

- They are really slow and they don't care
- They are disorganized and they don't care
- They don't understand the fact that I don't want whipped cream

It's a really crowded Starbucks on New Montgomery St in the heart of SOMA. I understand it but I can't wait 10 minutes waiting for my hot chocolate.

When finally they get it right, I love my extra hot, hot chocolate with no whipped cream but ... damn... I struggled to get it.
author: Marc L.

description:
This Starbucks is close to my school, and cheaper than the Trieste down the street.  I do enjoy a nice soy latte from Ritual when I'm looking to relax and read a book, but for me, Starbucks' are only for two things: black coffee and those damn breakfast sandwiches.  Now that they have a tall coffee/sandwich combo going on for $3.95, I'm hooked.

This particular Starbucks can get busy in the morning and around lunch, but what coffee shop in the financial district doesn't?

1 star for those damn English muffin sandwiches
1 star for consistently decent dark roast drip coffee
1 star for being cheaper than everywhere else
1 star for decent enough speed and customer service, considering how friendly I'd be if I was a student having to work there (which most of them appear to be).

Sometimes they run out of the sausage and turkey sandwiches by lunch time, and I'm afraid I might just cry, but then I remember how surprisingly good and filling their scones are, and order is restored to the world.
author: Melissa T.

description:
I know I hate Starbucks, but I never remember how much I hate them until I have to go in one (which is rarely).  However, I got a gift card for xmass and went through it as fast as possible.

Every drink I got there was bad in one way or the other - either weak, too sweet, too bitter (they don't know who to roast beans at all), and the food went from plain to atrocious.  What is that rubbery thing?  Is that supposed to be an egg?  When was this classified as an egg?  How long has it ceased to be an egg?

The staff wasn't rude, but wasn't especially friendly, but whatever.  Corporate stores aren't where you go to get a solid cup of coffee, a smile, or a tasty pastry.  Go anywhere but Starbucks in this neighborhood - coffee at Harvest & Rowe, Pastries at Tart to Tart (or even Specialties), bagels at Katz, and smoothies at Jamba Juice.  screw Starbucks.
author: Tmon B.

description: I usually go in at non-peak times but the service is always super friendly. Always get me drink right and even made a suggestion to make my drink better!
author: Danielle W.

description:
Let me preface my complaint of this Starbucks' customer service by noting that we moved to the Bay Area a couple years ago from NYC. And most people know the reputation NYC has for 'customer service.'
My 4 yr old loves Starbucks. Always friendly, always delicious (at least the ones in our neighborhood). But this location really threw her for a loop (me as well). We were staying at the Palace Hotel because my husband was attending an Orthopaedic conference. In the 2 1/2 days we stayed we visited three times. The place was definitely busy, most of the customers seemed to be surgeons at the conference with us. I didn't see any customers upset with the wait time and they all seemed happy to be at Starbucks, but for some reason the employees gave the impression that they were completely annoyed with our presence. Perhaps the place is usually empty and quiet? Not only were they annoyed, as I sat there with my girls we could see a lot of snickering and inside joking. They had a "this job would be great if it weren't for having to help customers" attitude. No friendly greeting or smiles, just "What can I get you?" And the sad part is it wasn't the same person who was unfriendly each time we came in, it was all of them. 
I've never seen so many employees in the customer service industry who clearly have a disdain for serving customers. Even my 4-yr old asked why they were so 'mad' there. I noticed a few 5 star reviews noting friendly baristas, but I can only assume those employees have since moved on.
Next time we'll look for a different location, even if it means walking a few extra blocks. I hate that we left feeling like we just asked for way too much. All we ordered was a kid's hot chocolate with no special requests, but I guess it was too much to ask???
author: Mae S.

description: Currently this is my go to starbucks. Yes there is like a starbucks on every corner in downtown SF.  But this one is really awesome for those that like to stay for a few hours and work on the computer/hang out. Firstly,  most folks get their drinks and go back to their office buildings or they may stay at a table just a short time, so there isn't a crazy amount of noise like there are at other starbucks (like the one just up the st).  Also, the layout of the store is quite spacious.  A lot of the starbucks just feel too cramped.  Only Negative: There is sometimes this really loud cashier (every time i hear her voice i want to plug up my ears)
author: Ka C.

description: Do NOT go to this Starbucks. A food service establishment should NOT have feces on their bathroom floor. It speaks volumes about their sanitation practices.
author: Danielle D.

description: The constant construction above this Starbucks makes this place so much less attractive and would rather walk to other cafes.
author: T L.

description:
Silly me.  I thought I'd be able to get away with writing just one, all-encompassing review of Starbucks, with a special focus on my wonderfully efficient "branch 'bucks" (the one in my office building).

But after my experience 20 minutes ago at the New Montgomery outlet, I now realize that I'm going to have to cast a wider net.  Each Starbucks has its own personality, no matter how corporate it may seem--and the personality of the New Montgomery Starbucks is 100% witch-spelled-with-a-"b".

Admittedly, it was my bad for walking in there with only a buck-fifty, knowing full well that my tall Americano is $1.70.  But that's why I have a credit card--to cover my arse in situations such as this. 

I ordered my drink from the rather sour looking girl behind the counter, and handed her my card.  She swiped it through the reader--once, twice, three times, four...you get the picture.  I apologized--once, twice, three times, four...again, you get the picture.  The line was growing.  She punched in my card number, fumbled more with the register.  My Americano was sitting there at the counter, waiting for me.  She'd mis-entered the number; it wasn't going through.

In a moment of desperation, I said, "Let me go get some cash for you."  She looked at me long and hard, and glared.  "No," she said, emphatically, obnoxiously, looking down her nose at me.  "No?" I replied, nonplussed.

"No."

She picked up my coffee, and she threw it away.

What?  Was she kidding me?  I'd volunteered to go get cash and come back for my (cold) coffee.  I wasn't suggesting that I steal it.  And what's more, just last week the same thing happened to a woman a few places in front of me in line at my wonderfully efficient branch 'bucks, and they'd handled the situation with nothing short of competence and class.
author: Hannah J.

description: This by far is my favorite Starbucks location.  Not only is it 2 seconds from work, but has the best service ever.  I once waited for an extra 2 minutes for a breakfast sandwich I ordered and got a free drink card!  I have weird requests for the drinks I order, and never gotten a weird look.  Plus after working at a coffee shop for more than 3 years - I know my drinks in and out - and I have no complaints about this store!
author: Ramoners D.

description: Good location. Bad custom service. The coffee tastes worse than every other starbucks I've had so far.
author: Dan L.

description:
one cup
two cup
three cup
more
caffeine makes me
go
go
go

Friendly service +
Sorry Hannah J. never had a coffee nazi (Seinfeld) moment there.  Sounds like it was a lot of fun.  ;)
author: Po L.

description: I used to go to this Starbucks as it was the most convenient cafe to where I used to work.  This place always FAILED at the morning rush, even with short lines.  It's simply just the employees lack of coordination and motivation.  Other Starbucks' don't fail as much as this one.  Get it together!
author: Lulu B.

description: service is good.  Too bad too many self important  yuppies are there being rude talking on cell phones loud enough for you to hear.
author: mike p.

description: i always make it in here at 6:55pm right as they're closing and despite the chairs being on the tables and people ready to go home, they're always very nice and helpful without being at all annoyed that i'm often running in at the last minute and asking for my espresso as their last customer.
author: lisa w.

description: Now that I moved, this Starbucks is on my way to BART.  I stop here a few times a week to pick up a coffee and turkey bacon sandwhich.  Since you know what you are getting at all Starbucks, the thing that makes the difference is the service.  This location is always friendly and attentive.
author: James B.
